reviewText:
I have a Dissertation projects, courseworks and Engagement party that need to be sorted out in less than 3 weeks.

Spent 24 hours playing this game. Worth it. No regrets. My fiancee and my supervisors wont however.

On a serious note. This game is fun. The comedy and even some plot twists on the story are excellent. Provides good laugh and pretty interesting dialogues and names in the terms of the summoned girls and the characters in general.

You start as a pretty much useless character that cant level up. But depending on your dedication, Ralph, your character, have the potential to grow through non level related item boost.

Dungeons are usually short. 5 levels each. With a boss in the end (well except 1 dungeon ) and a 9999 floor dungeon.

There are more than 30 girls to summon and play with. Each with different personality and skills. They will be your main fighting force in the beginning through most part of the game, while Ralph would became the support member until he can hold on his own.

Graphic is pretty decent for an RPG maker game. Same thing cannot be said for Sounds, as in they are TERRIFIC. The battle theme songs are catchy and are well made into the game.



MINI SPOILERS (No worries you probably should read this)

The tiny island with 3 dungeons are just part 1 of the game. Medium spoiler would reveal how many parts there are now. As the game keeps getting updated

MEDIUM SPOILERS (Answer to question on Mini Spoiler)
There are 6 parts for now. Games would be updated as promised by the developers over time

reviewText:
It's very retro graphics, on par with say SNES, but the gameplay is exquisite.
You cannot Level, but the girls you take with you can.
You can still accrue EXP, though, and you can give it to your girls, or use it as currency elsewhere.
You get beat down by a SLIME in the intro, and resurrected in a tavern by a man called the Haremancer, who summons two girls to help you.

Each townsperson you talk to gives you ONE MAXHP bonus, permanent. Since you start with a MAXHP of only 100, that's quite a bit more generous than it sounds! (Hint: This is a game where at high Levels, you regularly give and take blows of OVER 9000!)

Buying or selling in town gives the TOWN EXP!
That's right, THE TOWN can Level, but not you! You can still gain stats, though, from various Stat Up" hearts or veggies.
Rare

reviewText:
Don't be daunted by the negative reviews. From what I've gathered, most of them was a result of the game crashing, which to be perfectly honest does happen. But lo and behold! Open the discussion forum for this game and you'll find an easy fix to the issue. The developer pinned the discussion thread in the hopes that it could help us unfortunate souls from lost progression torment.

For those who have difficulty locating said solution need look no further. Just follow these simple easy instructions.
- Close game
- Open Run"
- Type "regedit"
- In the menu bar at the top
date:
go to "Edit" and then "Find"
- Type "Enterbrain" and press OK
- Wait for search result to populate
- Right-click on "Enterbrain" folder and delete

Now for the actual review. I gotta say
recommended: I enjoyed this game more than I thought I would. I found some of the conversations to be witty and charming
hoursPlayed: with a dash of humour all-around. Thyere's not much that hasn't been already said by others but a feature I found interesting is that if you take the time to read some of the item names and descriptions
voteText:
you'll find that the humour is present there as well.

An example would be the weapon Cross Sword.
It's description is a 5 letter word that starts with S
helpfulPercent: the answer is Sorry. It took me a couple of moments to recognize the joke
votesTotal: I actually laughed out loud (lame I know). Cross Sword = Crossword.\n\nBut I do wonder how in the world did I have 2 save files with leveled up characters in the first 2 save slots
votesFunny: before even playing the game. I've heard of others whose save files have been overwritten. My condolensces
commentsCount: my advice is to save on the lower save files
column17: have multiple save files so that the probability of your save files (and progress) disappearing would be lower."

The story, although slightly generic (you are sitll saving the world from a dark lord) takes some nice twist and turns, along side alot of content and fun companions. Of course some lines are cheesy, but the english translation of the game doesn't have any errors and is easy to read. The gameplay is the norm of RPG maker games, with magic, normal attacks, and special self skills". reviewText:
Finally. A light-hearted RPG Maker game of some quality. The girls' character designs are all great, the dialogue is short and to the point, the story is goofy but not tedious. There are lots of unlockables and a constant flow of treasures and abilities to unlock from each of the girls who resemble a variety of typical classes like Fighter or Mage.

It's the frivolous, high-paced Dragon Quest knockoff you've been waiting for. Recommended to fans of Half-Minute Hero or Azure Dreams.

The only caveat: this game is anti-grind, like Half-Minute Hero. You do a lot of running at high speeds and slaughtering parties of enemies at high speeds. The game makes fairly thin pretense at gameplay. That's why the steady stream of party member discoveries and unlockables is good, for feeding the frenzy. You're basically bingeing on cute unlockables.

reviewText:
This is one of the most clever games I've played. It simultaneously uses and lampoons or twists not just RPG tropes, but also anime girl stereotypes. Every time I think I've figured the game out, it throws some new surprise at me. All of the side stuff feels valuable in terms of either mechanics or story; I really can't think of another game that does that so well. And for a game which from the very start sets you up as needing to grind, the grinding is really quite pleasant.

TL;DR: I can't recommend it highly enough. It never feels like this game is wasting your time and it is hilarious.

reviewText:
So a cram school student, a cyclops, a robot, and a reaper walk into a bar...

I tend to turn my nose up to most RPGmaker games that ask for money to cross the toll into the title screen, unless I see some significant work put into the game's assets by the developer - if you can't be bothered to put some time doing your own thing to make it look like it's higher quality than some of the best of the free games done in the RPGmaker program out there, then it's not worth my money.

At first glance Hero and Daughter+ doesn't seem to do much, using basic art and sound assets, the only new assets I've noticed being the party member portraits.  Instead of focusing on making new graphics or sound, the devs have done significant work on mechanics and gameplay systems.

The game goes through a pleasurable feedback loop of handling preparation of dungeon romps in town with facilities that level up as you spend money on their wares, increasing their inventory or effects, and interacting and leveling up your team of summoned party members before heading out.

Dungeons themselves run off of a mild RNG permutation system, where the dungeons have at least 10 possible builds for each to go through, but the treasures/amount of monsters is diffrent upon each entry, certain dungeon builds will also have certain special bosses to fight, and you can adjust some of the variables of a dungeon before entry via a facility in town.  Monsters appear on the field, where running into them initiates a fight, and you have multiple enemy group types you can tell via their sprite, such as normal groups, mini-bosses, and special metal/gold slimes.  Special NPCs will also populate dungeons that add some variety in the form of mini-games or random chance events that can gamble with your stats/money in exchange for rare items.  Anytime you leave a dungeon, either via beating the dungeon's boss or being wiped out, you get to keep your experience and any items you've found.  There is also a chance of a random event playing out between characters when coming back from a dungeon.

The game is very freewheeling with how it doles out improvements to your group, while your main character cannot level up, he can still accumulate experience which can be used as a special currency for certain facilities or as bonus experience for party members, and your party members already can level up incredibly fast.
But most of all, your party members are powerful.  Any given character will feel like they would be completely overpowered in any other game given their special abilities.  Especially early on, unlocking a character's abilities is a treat in opening up new ways of completely stomping the opposition, and several characters can easily keep single enemies - bosses included - on lockdown.
Do you need your party to have every stat buffed immediately with the possibility to constantly stack buffs?  There's a character for that
Do you need to do armor piercing multi hit combos to an entire enemy group? There's a character for that
Do you need to charm a boss?  There's a character for that
Don't take this as an endorsement of the game being easy, party synergy is a big part of this, but later game situations will take into account that you can do all of this.

Getting said overpowered miracles of destruction requires summon stones, which you can get in chests, from bosses, or special challenges.   Any time a summoning stone is spent it gives you a random girl from the playable roster, and they take up place in the town's pub, where you can talk with them, give them gifts, or pour EXP from your personal stash into them.  It's ok to be greedy with snatching girls from various places across the multiverse, as any you leave in town while dungeon romping will help level the town up.
The writing for all the game's characters is light hearted and goes for a rather teenage sensibility, there's not much in the way of long winded rants or incredibly serious and dire emotional scenes, everything is in service to the comedy and doing mild exploration of character personalities and backstories.

While the game's content might seem sparse at the first glance of what you are dealing with, you can be assured it will offer up plenty of new features and optional challenges to do as you advance forward.   And if you should ever feel you might be getting a bit too overpowered, there are features down the line that allow you to adjust character stats as you see fit.


I whole heartedly recommend this, it reminds me of the simple joy older console RPGs use to go for in the 90's, and if you recall the Ancient Cave" from the lufia/estapolis series
date: then you have a similar idea at play here."

reviewText:
Very good game. I put more hours into this than some AAA games. The story and dialogue were humorous which not only make the interactions between main characters but also enemies interesting. The only complaint I have is that the grind towards the town lv100 achievement is extremely tedious. Funny how the best character is Lara, the first girl you summon at the beginning; Ralph loses his levels only to get fair compensation.

Ending team composition: Ralph, Akari, Lara, Liria

Tower lv9999 team composition: Carrot, Spirit Queen, Red Witch, Sutorega

One thing to note is that buying a house does not contribute to village level. If only I knew this when I started out, before I bought the 1M house.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Story:
Minimal, but also lighthearted and made fun of various JRPG and anime tropes.

Visual:
Uses a lot of vanilla RPGMaker resources except the girls. Your mileage may vary on the girls' art and CG.

Gameplay:
Tons of grinding but battles are very quick and fun. The girls' skill list pretty much categorize the girls into three categories: melee attacker, magic attacker, and support. But you can make any of the characters learn all the magic available in the game. The main character cannot level up but there's various ways for him to raise his stats and learn skills, making him very powerful later in the game.

There's also tons of other stuff to do in the game. There's village and town upgrading (via levels), arranging furniture, challenge tower for the girls, extra dialogues and hot spring events for the girls, and more unlocked the further you go into the game.

Recommended for those who are looking for:
- JRPG with tons of battles which are quick and fun
- Parodies of various JRPG & anime tropes
- An RPGMaker game with more stuff than a straight RPG
- 2D girls

Not recommended for those who are looking for:
- A deep story
- An RPGMaker game without any of vanilla RPGMaker resources
voteText: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Waifu collecting game that never ends

anime/10


-Serious Review-
A nice traditional RPG with a pretty anime-esque plot.  It's already pulled the credits on me 3 times and there's still more to do, I just discovered an entirely new area.  The girls all got plenty of variations and if you get a lucky first few summons  you can  have  a solid party that you go with throughout much of the game.  The artwork  is a nice kinda simple style, some characters well  dressed and others.... hardly dressed.  There's also loads and loads of side stuff besides the main story to keep you busy.  Probably more busy than the main story.  Besides the girl's portraits and battle sprites, as far as I can tell a lot of pretty much everything else is straight from the RPG maker starting pack with some nice touch-ups and edits here and there

I guess something I would nitpick is that there was a fairly large level gap at one point that I hit because my party set-up was really good for bosses, and now dungeons are a big hassle.  That's just me not grinding  a bit, so if you're totes fine with grinding, good amount of hours to kill with this.


9/10
would be 10/10 if more custom-made sprites and portraits instead of default RPGmaker and 15 if steam didn't  want censoring

reviewText:
This is a great example of what RPG maker can bring to the table. Not only is the story funny, its laid out very well and flows perfectly. Its almost surprising how well the game is made. While the story is a bit cliche, ( go out and defeat a dark lord and save the world ) It brings a new experiace to RPGs. It's halarious, fun, exciting, and at times a bit cring worthy, but its all put together so well that you cant seem to step away.

I love how; while your entire party is made up of girls, its not over sexualized. Every new girl brings something new to your game, and while you'll end up favoring just a few, the combos of girls are unlimited.
Angel, Red Witch, and Princess, are my personal favorite companions but I have not even begun to experiment with all the girls, let alone unlock them all.

This game is worth playing if you are looking for a bit of light hearted comedy and adventure.

reviewText: I love this game to death, I do. Music's fantastic, characters are interesting, the art is good, and the gameplay is straightforward and simple yet still fun. But something is seriously screwy with it lately. All of a sudden one day I loaded it up to find two completely alien saves where mine should have been. Characters I hadn't unlocked, relationships and levels swapped around. Honestly, it sorta pisses me off.\n\nAgain, I love this game to death, but I can only hope they get their stuff together. I don't think I'll be willing to play again until my saves and progress are safe. Regardless, I can confidentially say people should be interested in the game. With the amount of updates it gets, you'd figure it's only a matter of time until the fix whatever's wrong. Buy it now, or hold off until the air clears.

reviewText:
(Edited Review)

I am updating my review due to the fix of the issue I had previously. Since the below issue has been resolved I will gladly re-recommend this game.

I've been having a ton of fun playing this game so far. I had built 2 parties, a main and secondary, the former hitting about level 80 while mid dungeon. While the game is relatively simple in terms of play, the amount of content involved clearly took a lot of time to develop. There are plenty of small aspects that add up to make this a very worth-while play. I did, however, run into an issue: mid dungeon after my party had gained about 10 levels my party bugged after a battle and would only run straight down. Not just that, but in the menu and in combat the down key did not work at all. I tabbed out to see if my key had broken but it worked fine elsewhere, so it was an in-game issue. After trying to figure things out for about 10 minutes my game closed out (no chance to save as you have to move UP in order to get to the save point in the tavern). Upon restarting my game most of the characters I had acquired (and I had them all) were gone. It did not revert to a previous save as the first characters I had acquired were missing. The remaining characters were missing almost all of their levels, ranging from 5-12, only random characters were remaining and only a few of them. Another thing of note was that I somehow had 2 save files when I had only ever used one. I would have liked to send this message to the developer directly to try to provide anymore information as to help solve this issue but I'm not sure how to do that.

Before this happened this was an amazing game, very well thought out and had great gameplay. As of right now this is kind of a big issue though... there isn't much of a point to building something up when you know somewhere down the road it will just be torn down. I will gladly update this review if they can get the problem solved.

reviewText:
This is a great game, and as someone who who works a lot with RPG Maker VX Ace, I'm amazed how good it is.

The plot is cliche and won;t win awards, it's the bog standard RPG cliche of toppling some random dark lord, but that aside, this game is very aware of it's cliches and mocks the crap out of them.

Of course, it's kinda meta, but even that isn't all. This game has the unique twist you are Level 1 and cannot gain levels at all, meaning you have to farm stat boosters and rely on allies (if you are into waifus, which all your allies are, you will have fun getting them all, like a non pornographic Pokemon meets harem anime, though it's a bit ecchi though, be warned if that turns you off)

The gameplay is mix of Diablo style dungeon crawling (with maps that are semi-random like the bonus dungeons in Final Fantasy 1 & 2 Dawn of Souls and classic front view RPG turn based combat, though with the twist all you allies are very specialized and you must pick and choose wisely.

However, you must try to keep all your summoned waifus leveled and well equipped, as the game includes a sim element where you level up" a village
recommended: the village get attacked from time to time

reviewText:
Okay, I'm going out on a limb a little bit here, and recommending this game.

Its fun, grindy, and a serious call back to old school rpg's.

HOWEVER.

This game is a little...Glitchy.

I've had a number of issues, where members of the summoned party members have rearranged themselves. The game has crashed, and completely erased summoned characters. Its even radically changed what level I was on, and opened tons of other areas I hadn't even been to yet.

It has made playing a bit more random, and in a way, has kept it from getting boring...BUT, I like to know that spending 4 hours leveling a set of characters wasn't completely wasted when I log back in and suddenly find them all at level twenty when they were previously 100+

That being said, I find the Level 1 hero to be an interesting and creative twist, if somewhat time consuming in terms of dungeon crawling and lady leveling.

Other then the issues with in game glitching, I've actually really enjoyed the game.

OF course, I'd enjoy it more if it didn't feel like a beta run, but that could just be me.

reviewText:
I wouldn't have believed that I'd ever call an RPGMaker game about anime girls as one of my all time favorite games, but here it is. I don’t normally even buy RPGMaker games, although after playing this for quite a while I’ve started paying more attention to them.

Anyway, this is just an incredibly entertaining game. Your hero gets stuck at level 1, so he has to summon girls from other worlds to do the fighting for him. There are quite a lot of these girls and all of them have different skills. Apart from the first girl you can’t really know who you’ll get, since the summons are random, so you’ll have to come up with strategies which work with whoever you have.

The story actually does eventually progress from there, but I don’t feel like spoiling it too much. I’ll just say that there is much more content in this game than it initially seems. I literally thought about 10 times I had finally beaten the game, and more content just kept appearing... The difficulty also builds up gradually. The game seems to be very easy at first, but it’s only because you aren’t as far into it as you think. There are also characters who seem to be quite crappy, but whose skills are actually good at some point later on.

So yeah, the fighting is quick and entertaining, there is lots of things to do, the girls are cute, the music is great, the humor is funny, what can I say except highly recommend this game?

reviewText:
Pros:
Tons of waifus.
Genuinely funny.
Good parodies of common JRPG/anime tropes.
Just a bit lewd.

Cons:
Really boring grindy gameplay.
Waifus are not well-developed in most cases.
Often generic characters.
Art can be questionable.
It's an RPGmaker game.

Overall, if you like waifus and don't mind boring gameplay (and dropping 10 dollars for it) then I recommend it.  Otherwise I'd wait for a steep price cut or major sale.

reviewText:
'Hero and Daughter' is a silly game at its core, so don't expect a serious storyline. The interactions and cut scenes are fun though, and there's a ton of characters (girls) for you to choose from for you team.

Once you unlock them by finding enough Summon Stone's that is.

Beyond that, the game's a dungeon crawler that has you repeatedly delving into four different areas (based on your level), gathering treasure, fighting monsters, and moving toward the Dark Lord at the end of the fourth dungeon. Simple, but hard to put down. For the price, definitely recommend it.

reviewText:
It's an RPGMaker Game...Your milage may vary depending on how you see things and I've seen some really good ones...and some really bad or wierd ones out there throughout the years.

This one? This just makes fun of itself I believe. All you need to know is already on the tin so to speak. Your character, is stuck on being a level one weakling (although you can gain stats from a few sources) and you need to summon girls (who are at the beginning, stronger than you) to defeat the Dark Lord.

By the way, take a very wild stab at why the title is what it is. You may get lucky very fast. It's either that or a mistranslation of what the word may be.

The original artwork is...well while not horrible per say, seem off in certain (female) characters that make them look a bit...creepy at the most. Even though it's not on a 'professional' level, you have to give props for effort. Maybe the fellow's next game (if they decide to that is) could have better artwork if they tried.

People would probably wait for...probably a half off sale, but it's nice for a laugh and you can't put a pricetag on laughter.

reviewText:
*DISCLAIMER: I was provided with a preview copy of the game by the publisher.

Hero & daughter+ is a fresh new approach to an already very saturated jrpg market what with the availability & ease of use of RPG Maker, almost anyone can make an rpg game these days. The only thing is that this one truly stands apary from the rest.

Basically the story goes like this...
Having been setup by his own kind, our cocky hero loses his hero level & is forced to fight the forces of evil by teaming up with a selection of over 30+ quirky & beautiful girls who can hold their own in any fight. These beauties are his only option and any experience he accumulates in dungeon battles, he has to pass over to them.

Genius. Absolute genius. My only gripe is that it has very low resolution & full screen just makes everything look fat & wonky. Other than that, this game is my favorite rpg of 2016 so far.

Gameplay video:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=627131521
